meanings.sent1: The clattering of pots and pans woke up the entire house.
meanings.sent2: I heard the clattering of hooves as the horses approached.
meanings.sent3: The clattering of the old typewriter made it sound like it was laughing.
meanings.sent4: The clattering of rain on the tin roof sounded like a thousand tiny drums.
meanings.sent5: The clattering of the train passing by was so loud it drowned out all other sounds.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, continuous rattling sound.
meanings.sent1: The wind caused the windows to clatter loudly.
meanings.sent2: The pots and pans clattered noisily as she dropped them in the sink.
meanings.sent3: The old bones clattered in the closet, scaring the cat.
meanings.sent4: Her teeth chattered so loudly it sounded like they were clattering together.
meanings.sent5: The hailstones clattered against the window, creating a cacophony of noise.

meanings.definition: The act of making a loud, continuous rattling sound.
meanings.sent1: The sudden clattering of the dishes falling to the floor startled everyone.
meanings.sent2: His footsteps echoed with a clattering noise in the empty hallway.
meanings.sent3: The clattering of the keys on the piano filled the room with music.
meanings.sent4: The clattering of the construction work outside made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent5: The clattering of the car engine signaled that it was time for a tune-up.
